headline: Chili Mac
description: This chili mac starts with a quick and easy beef chili made on the stove mixed with pasta and cheese, then baked in the oven for a comforting meal.
name: Chili Mac
recipeIngredient: 1 (14.5 ounce) can Mexican or chili-style stewed tomatoes, undrained
2 cups elbow macaroni or small shells, cooked and drained
2 cups Sargento ® Shredded Reduced Fat 4 Cheese Mexican Cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Cook ground beef, onion, and bell pepper in a large skillet over medium heat until beef is crumbly and no longer pink, about 5 minutes; pour off drippings. Add tomatoes, water, and taco seasoning; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Stir cooked pasta into meat mixture until combined. Spoon 3 cups meat mixture into an 11x7-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with 1 cup cheese; top with remaining meat mixture. Cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove foil; sprinkle with remaining cheese. Continue baking until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this tonight and my wife said this is a keeper. There were only two changes I made. I sautéed the onion and pepper (used red pepper instead of green) for about 3 minutes before putting in the ground beef. Also I used two 10oz cans of Rotel tomatoes since this is a sort of Mexican dish. Plenty of leftovers for the two of us and we'll be making this again!
The family loved it!

Seriously! An 11x7 pan did not accommodate even the “required 3 cups of the mixture” let alone all the cheese that’s called for. We had a little shy of 4 cups of “the mixture” left. XERO room in the pan for the cheese. The total recipe was followed to a “T”. Plus, all the baking time? Oh My Gosh! If We had followed this, We would have had a pan of mush.
Oh how I love this simple easy recipe. It is so delicious and my family loves it. I did add a can of tomato sauce and a few more spices. I also used ground turkey instead of Ground meat.
Great recipe just wasn't enough. I'm going to double the recipe next time

Very easy recipe that your family will enjoy!
I did make a few minor adjustments:
- Added 2 cloves of chopped garlic.
- Added additional tablespoon of taco seasoning.
- Used petite tomatoes vs Mexican style tomatoes. 
My husband told me this recipe is a keeper, that's a compliment!

Firstly this recipe doesn't make much sense. To me I don't know why they made Chili Mac and there isn't any chili powder, cumin or even chili seasoning packets. To me, it isn't chili mac if you're using taco seasoning. But this is what I did and changed. 

Used Chili Seasoning instead of Taco Seasoning 
Added 1 can of the diced tomato 
Used 1/4 cup of water. Reducing the 1/2 cup because of the extra can of diced tomatoes I added.

Very tasty dish. Much better and healthier than hamburger helper chili Mac. I didn’t have Mexican style canned tomatoes so I added a small can of green chilies. I didn’t layer in the cheese. I just topped it with the cheese and baked covered for 30 minutes. I will definitely make this again.
We loved the finish product....changed a little bit, added red peppers instead of green, added black beans, and of course avocados and sour cream on the top! Yum

The picture made this look just like a recipe my mom made when I was growing up, so that was my motivation for making this. 

About half way through, I realized it was not going to be the same as mom's (picture is obviously a modified version of the recipe: added beans & etc), so I took some liberties and customized it a little bit myself by adding a jalapeño & some additional pepperjack cheese.

Family ALL loved it. Teens & toddlers included. I was surprised by how much they raved about it. Our only suggestion would be to use less macaroni and maybe add yet another (orange or roasted red) pepper.

My favorite thing about this recipe (besides making me a hero-chef) is how it is a hit without being salty. No added salt or salty ingredients, other than cheese....and you can reduce the amount of cheese if you really want to.

I wouldn’t change a thing. I will make it again. Allrecipes has never let me down!
Cheryl C

I wouldn’t change a thing. I will make it again. Allrecipes has never let me down!
Cheryl C
used sodium free tomatoes, sweet bell peppers, diced green chilies and finely chopped green onions. on top before serving we used crispy hatch chilies
Absolutely wonderful recipe!

I used 1.5 lbs of hamburger, home made taco seasoning (2 packets worth), and did not have the Mexican tomatoes so used the can of crushed tomatoes I had along with a fresh chopped tomato. I did not add the water where there was so much more tomato than called for. Only had half the cheese but after mixing it up I put the cheese on top and only baked 20 min covered and it was delish. My advise is top with sour cream. I had some without it first and it was great but as leftovers put some on and the difference is crazy.
Omg! Sooo easy to make that even a kitchen flunky like myself could do it. This was incredibly delicious.
Loved it. So simple and tasty. I cooked the meat with taco seasoning and added extra cheese.

Wonderful recipe. I did a couple of changes. I didn’t use stewed tomatoes or green pepper. I used diced tomatoes with green chili’s. I also add corn and pinto beans. It came out great! Thank you for posting!!
Great!

I left off the cheese (not a big fan of cheese).
I added about 1 Tbs of chili powder.
It was a little dry, but still very tasty.
My next batch (next weekend) will include one bottle of Heinz Chili Sauce.

I love Chili Mac, so this simple recipe works great. My youngest son loved it (hates green / red peppers, chunk tomato, etc), and scarfed it down without a thought after I told him the ingredients.
OUTSTANDING!!! I cannot overstate how delicious this was. There was no talking at the table, just scarfing, ate way more than I should have! LOL This will be a cold weather regular for sure!
I used rotel instead stewed tomatoes. Also added more cumin and onion powder. Next time I will add a can of green chilies.
I added Chili seasoning rather than a Taco seasoning packet. Loved it! Will try Taco sometime, as well. YUM!!!

I essentially wanted to make a thicker chili with some mac and cheese in the mix. This was not that. This was glorified hamburger helper. I followed almost everything to a T. The only changes I made were the recommendations about cook time. Covered for 10 minutes, uncovered for 5. Other than that, as per the rest of the recipe it tastes absolutely nothing like chili. The taco seasoning throws everything off. It doesn't even taste like taco-y goodness. There wasn't enough sauce to cover everything right. Shredded cheese did nothing to help what so ever. I'm probably mostly disappointed by the fact that this wasn't what I thought or hoped it would be.
My wife and I made this dish and it was pretty good. I added some fresh grated peppercorn and it put the dish over the top for me. We will be making it again.

I made it!!!! I followed this exact recipe. It was super easy, and my family loved it!!
Printed out the recipe, were definitely making this again soon.????
I will make this again. I followed recipe exactly, but I had regular diced tomatoes. Turned out just fine for us.

Mine was a bit dry, maybe liquid from tomatoes and 1/2 cup water was not enough. Foil was tight for baking. Perhaps 2 splashes of canned tomato juice next time.
I added just under a half of a serano pepper into the skillet for a pleasant sting.
Overall, a good recipe
I used Adams Reserve New York Extra Sharp Cheddar instead of Sargento cheese

I forgot to add something to my review that might help others. I cooked the entire thing in my large, oven proof skillet. I didn't layer the cheese. Instead, I just "poked" some down into the mac/meat mixture in a few places and then spread most of it over the top. Covered with the skillet lid, and cooked. Essentially a one pot dinner - except for the pasta pot.

Very good and easy, but I had to make a few changes to accommodate what was in my pantry. I only used one can of beans, and plain canned diced tomatoes. I added a dash of chili powder to compensate. I also added a can of water and cooked the macaroni right in the same pot for 30 min. Topped with some tortilla strips and hubby loved it.
Will make it again, it was a bit dry so will modify it somehow, maybe more tomatoes.
Good food fast,
This is my recipe to use for potlucks. It's gone in 5 minutes every time.

Excellent dish. I agree with the comment that recommends only baking 10-12 minutes, it really comes out perfect that way. If you really want to make it good, sub chili seasoning for taco seasoning and use sharp cheddar.
Will definitely make this dish again
VERY good and easy

I used ground beef, 1 can of hot Rotel chili and tomatoes and added 2 tbsp of diced jalapenos. (we like spicy!) I left the mixture in the pot and added the cheese and it melted while it rested. It was delicious and I will make it again. Thank you!
I changed the recipe in one way by adding a pack of chili seasoning in place of the taco seasoning. It turned out very well. I’ll be making this again soon!

This was a HIT with my four sons! It was very easy to make! This is now on my list of quick and easy dinners to make. I added a little bit more ground beef and a little more of the potatoes just to make sure I had enough for the boys.

This dish was awesome and simple to make. I just had a 1 oz packet of taco seasoning and just added 2oz of chili powder(essentially the same minus the garlic powder, etc). Will definitely make this again and I might add some sour cream in with the stewed tomatoes or simply just add a dollop or two when ready to eat. Great recipe and absolutely delicious.

This is so good. I plan to make it for a family cook out for Father's Day. The only thing I changed was I used just plain tomatoes in a can. I didn't have the Mexican style on hand at the time. The plain worked just fine.

This is quite good. As others had to, I improvised items from my pantry when exact items weren't available. I used 2 - 10.5 oz cans rotel and added 1/2 can tomato paste to get a good consistency. I used mild cheddar cheese and added 4 slices of provolone in the middle section for extra cheesiness. We liked it.
I didn't make any changes. We loved it and will make again.

Very good! The taco seasoning is the ticket (I made a version from allrecipes). I cut the cheese in half because I got tired of grating, but it is necessary to thicken the sauce. I think some of the confusion about “not enough sauce or makes a lot” comes from the 2 cups COOKED pasta—that’s 1 cup uncooked or 1/2 a package or less of pasta (I used half a box—8 oz). I wish I doubled the recipe because there is less than one serving leftover between my husband and I!
I used regular diced tomatoes plus a can of chili with beans plus about 1/2 can water. I like spicy so added chili powder, cumin and paprika to taste. Yummy!

This dish is really good! I had about 2 C of pinto beans in the frig so added them in too. Substituted Rotel tomatoes with peppers & one can of tomato sauce since we were out of regular canned tomatoes. Hubby loved it!

Made this tonight with brown rice macaroni, Rotel tomatoes, can chili beans. Instead of taco seasoning I used cumin, garlic powder/salt, chili powder and a few shakes of Joe's Stuff (New Orleans seasoning). didn't use as much cheese as everyone else, used less. Baked in oven for 20 mins. I'll be making this again.
It was good. Next time I will season the meat in the soffrito, it was a little bland. The saving grace was the fact that I am not a cheese sprinkler, I'm a cheese piler.
I can't believe all my family not only liked it but took two to three helpings each and I have some picky eaters. The only thing I did differently was boil the noodles in a beef stock.

We really enjoyed this meal. After reading some reviews, I made a few changes, which really made this meal outstanding. The changes I made were to use corkscrew pasta, I used 1 and a half cans of the tomatoes, added a small can of diced green chile, seasoned with Lawrys seasoning salt (found it was too bland without it), and I used more cheese. Also, make sure to cook your pasta al dente or it might get mushy since you are also cooking it more in the oven. Since all of the ingredients are already cooked when you put everything together, I baked at 375 covered for 10 minutes, then uncovered for an additional 5. Served with sour cream. It was delicious and made amazing leftovers!

Delicious! Was a hit with the entire family! I randomly thought to look this recipe up and luckily had all the ingredients on hand. I did make my own taco seasoning, added a little more chili powder and emptied a can of tomato paste to give it a thicker consistency. It was a hit!
turned out ok. the family liked it
Needed more flavor so I added a can of hot chili beans from my pantry & some jarred jalapeños. Yum, entire family loved it.
Added kidney beans and skipped peppers.

Everyone loved this simple but tasty recipe ( adults, teens, & tweens)! I used Jumbo Ridged Macaroni (which holds its shape when stirred into in hearty dishes), mild McCormick taco seasoning, mild Rotel tomatoes, and Mexican blend shredded cheese. The "extras" I added were a sprinkle of Fiesta Ranch dry mix, & a can of store brand chili with beans. I added these just in case it wasn't flavorful enough as written, as I'd used an extra 1/2 pound of meat & doubled the noodles to be sure there was enough for a sleepover guest. I think it would have been just as good the original way though, & I feel it could also allow for substitutions/experiments when desired. We also ate crushed tortilla chips with it, yum! Fast n' easy! Thanks for the recipe. :-)
Simple but very tasty.

Many years ago I had an aunt who made this and I fell in love with it. Then I joined the Navy and this was a regular item on the menu and was often served for mid rats while at sea. I was reminded of Chili Mac on a FB Navy Vets page and decided to make it. To my knowledge I have never made Chili Mac so this was my first try. I found it to be very easy and fast enough to make and I followed the recipe for the most part with the exception of adding about a tablespoon of chili powder to make the dish less bland. In addition I only cooked it for 15 minutes to brown which is more than enough since everything is already cooked. I will definitely make this one more frequently since it has leftovers worth eating again.
BLAH! I made this dish exactly as directed. Don't waste you time, it was so bland.
I loved this and wanted to eat bowl after bowl after bowl. I may go get more right now.

I did alter the recipe a bit as I doubled the recipe . I was concerned the casserole might get dry. I used 2 cans (14.5 oz) of diced chili-seasoned tomatoes, 1 can (10 oz) of diced tomatoes with green chiles and one can (14.5 oz) of Mexican-stewed tomatoes. The grandkids LOVED it! We will definitely make this again!
Great recipe! I made a few alterations by making my own taco seasoning and adding black beans.
I didn't make any changes. I increased the qty to feed 80 school lunches. The kids really liked it and so did the teachers. The seasoning was perfect for kids.

Tasty. I recommend cooking macaroni al dente otherwise it turns mushy. I added my own touches, as most folks noted in the comments. I also made it in my cast iron skillet, just topped with cheese and threw it in the oven uncovered for 30 min.
I made this for the 1st time. It was good.
This worked out great! Served it with cornbread and a salad.

This was very dry. Not enough sauce and quite bland. For flavor I added black pepper, and garlic powder. I would have doubled the sauce but was in a hurry so I added a can of tomato sauce and a can of pintos. Will look for another recipe.
Family loved! Added one diced jalapeno and used2.5 Tblsp Chili powder and 1 tsp garlic powder instead of taco seasoning mix. (Penzy's of course!!!) Will make again.
So I didn't use stew tomatoes I used tomato sauce and didn't use green peppers I used garlic. Yummy!
My kids asked me for a second plate of this. Not only that, there was not a word said at the table while they were inhaling this. I think they broke a world record.
awesome recipe, I made a double batch of this and it was gone, when i cook, my biggest critics are my 8 kids, each and every one of them loved it......thank you
definitely not what I expected ....it tasted too much like hamburger helper...too much work if u just want to eat hamburger helper

Loved it, but I did make changes.
I added a pinch of salt and two (2) tablespoons of Sugar.
and 1/2 a cup of spaghetti sauce as the meat seemed a bit dry.
Made this last night and it was a hit! I personally would've liked more tomatoes but it was very delicious!

I made this and the family really enjoyed it. I did have to make some small changes due to what supplies I had on hand and not cooking the pasta ahead of time. I used fire roasted salsa style diced tomatoes instead of the stewed tomatoes. I also added one extra cup of water to the mixture, because I just added the pasta uncooked to the mixture and still baked it for the same amount of time. The pasta came out cooked perfectly fine.
Baking time can be shorter if you cook the onion and bell pepper until soft before adding taco seasoning and tomatoes. Otherwise, great recipe.
Love it! Used uncooked noodles and let it cook a little longer!

This was good, but I wanted to spice it up a bit. I added a 4oz can of diced chilies along with a can of rotel diced tomatoes and green chiles and a bit of frozen corn. I used ground turkey and only drained it partially, using the moisture and not adding extra water.

Oh my goodness, this was fabulous! My 8 year old, who is very picky, gave this a very enthusiastic thumbs up! He doesn't like onions so I used 1tsp onion powder instead. I also made homemade taco seasoning from this website, and it was a little spicy for my son but nothing a little sour cream couldn't help! I very much recommend this recipe, especially for kids!
My family really enjoyed this. I added a can of mexican corn and crunched up fritos on top. It was delicious!

Very delicious, very easy. Had left over noodles from when I made too much spaghetti. Added chili beans to the recipe and took out the pepper. Since everything was still hot from being simmered I only cooked for 25 min and put the top layer of cheese on before placing in the oven. I will for sure be trying again and again.
It was good, and easy. my son really liked it, my husband gobbled up two bowls before I was half way through my first, but I don't think I'd make it again.

I had some leftover homemade turkey chili, and I was looking for an easy Chili Mac recipe with high ratings. This one seemed like exactly what I was looking for, and it was. I had about 3 cups of leftover chili, so I used it along with half the amounts of macaroni and cheese called for in the recipe. I followed step 2 exactly, spooning half of the mixture in the dish and topping with half the cheese, and then adding the rest of the mixture. I baked it for 30 minutes covered and then added the remaining cheese and baked 5 more minutes. For a smaller batch, I probably should have put it in a smaller pan, such as a loaf pan. However, it was fine as prepared. I would echo the comments of a couple of reviewers that it could have used a little more cheese. That's a personal preference, though. I imagine that it would even be delicious with your favorite canned chili if you were pressed for time.
Great! !!

This is a really good recipe. I didn't have diced tomatoes so I used a canof tomato paste with 14.5 ounces of water. I also substituted the onions and green pepper with Pictsweet seasoning blend which contained onions Green peppers and celery. The only thing I would change about this recipe is the amount of recommended cheese. I would suggest using 1cup of cheese to start. Also I seasoned with salt and pepper.
Easy & best thing is having all ingredients in my pantry!! My family loved it! I added Tortilla Chips before serving. Definitely a winner!!!
Love this! I've made this numerous times and it always turns out delicious!
This was fabulous! Followed the recipe exactly and everyone loved it.
I am making this right now. But I added fresh tomatoes and zucchini. Also put taco chips on top before I put it in the oven and added lots of cheese. Served with sour cream too.

It was Ok. Not the best chili mac recipe. The water seemed to take away most of the flavor which made it a little bland and for some reason a weird aftertaste. I think the juice from the tomatoes would be enough liquid for the seasoning package.

I tried this recipe but changed servings to 16. Recipe was confusing. I didn't use 4 cups of cheese. It says in the recipe to sprinkle 1 cup cheese and top of first layer. Then over remaining meat mixture. Well, if it takes 4 cups of cheese how could you only use 1 cup on the first layer?? I baked 30 minutes and added more cheese to top but not using anywhere close to 4 cups of cheese. Made it for my Bunco group and there are 16 of them so we'll see what they have to say. Will stick with 6 serving recipe next time.

Very tasty, next time I make this I'll definitely be doubling the cheese and maybe adding a little sour cream to the mix. Or at least set it out on the table for anyone that would like to top their plate with some.

This is a great and easy recipe, I used wheat penne macaroni, ground turkey, Italian stewed tomatoes and added 6oz of tomato paste with a 1/4 cup extra water. I like to make this on Monday and eat it for the next three days.
Very good! It’s even better the next day.
This was very easy to make. I was able to use ingredients from my pantry. I even added 1/2 a jar of spaghetti sauce that I had left in the fridge. My boys loved it!!! Will definately make again!!!!!

I wish you could give half-stars because I would really rate this a 4.5. I always view the reviews before I try something and given the mixed ones for this particular recipe I didn't have high hopes...BOY WAS I SURPRISED I made the recipe as written (with the exception of using regular stewed tomatoes because I couldn't find "mexican" stewed ones) and it was VERY TASTY and I will definitely be making it again. However next time, I will probably use Rotel diced tomatoes and green chili's mainly because I didn't like big chunks of stewed tomatoes (I tried chopping them smaller but they were still to big for my liking) and I like my food spicy. The only thing I noticed was a 11 x 17 pan was a bit to big so I used a smaller 9" inch square pan and it was just right.

Can't quite see why you need to bake it for 30 min. Everything is already cooked before you place it in the oven.All you need to do is melt the cheese which can be done in 10-12 min.instead of 30.Baking it for 30 min dries it out.

I doubled this recipe but forgot to double the tomatoes and it still came out great! I served this dish with a salad and had chopped tomatoes and scallions on the side. My husband added the tomatoes and scallions on top of the chili mac and it was even better!!! I did add a little pasta water to moisten.
It was okay.
